ARABIC: فَأَتَتْ بِهِۦ قَوْمَهَا تَحْمِلُهُۥ قَالُوا۟ يَٰمَرْيَمُ لَقَدْ جِئْتِ شَيْـًٔا فَرِيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: She brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, 'Maryam! You have done an unthinkable thing!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then she brought the child to her people. They exclaimed: "O Mary, you have done a most astonishing thing!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then she came to her people, carrying her baby. They said: "O Mary! You have committed a monstrous thing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: She took him to her people and they said, "Mary, this is indeed an strange thing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So carrying him in her arms, she brought him to her people; they said, “O Maryam, you have indeed committed a great evil!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said: "O Mary! Indeed you have brought a thing Fariy."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And she came to her people with him, carrying him (with her). They said: O Marium! surely you have done a strange thing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then she brought the child to her folk carrying him; and they said, 'Mary, thou hast surely committed a monstrous thing!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then she brought him to her own folk, carrying him. They said: O Mary! Thou hast come with an amazing thing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Carrying her child, she brought him to her people. They said, "O Mary, you have indeed done something terrible!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then she brought him to her nation carrying him. They said: Maryam! assuredly thou hast brought a thing unheard Of.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then carrying him she brought him to her people. They said, ‘O Mary, you have certainly come up with an odd thing!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: At length she brought the (babe) to her people, carrying him (in her arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou brought!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then she brought him (the baby) to her people, carrying him. They said: "O Mary! Indeed you have brought a thing Fariya (an unheard mighty thing).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: She came to her nation, carrying him; and they said: 'O Mary, you have committed a monstrous thing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then she came to her people, carrying him. They said, “O Mary, you have done something terrible.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:27] Then, carrying him, she brought him to her folk (tahmiluhu, ‘carrying him’, a circumstantial qualifier), and they saw him, and they said, ‘O Mary, truly you have done a curious thing!, an astounding [thing], for you have begotten a son without [his having] a father.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then she brought him) i.e. Jesus (to her own folk, carrying him) when he was forty days old. (They said: Mary! thou hast come with an amazing thing) you have come with an abominable act.
